background_info.description: Important background information that will be used as context by a GPT-3.5 model to create the document. Should contain all context information needed to generate document, including specific details and relevant technical information.

language.description: The target human language for the generated document.
language.title: Language

page_count.description: The number of document pages (or number of presentation slides) to generate.

prompt.description: Instructions that will be used by a GPT-3.5 model to create the document. The instructions should be detailed and contain important information.

url.description: [OPTIONAL] URL to import data for document creation, such as web link, Google Drive / OneDrive link or aidocmaker.com link.
url.title: Url

f1_http_url.description: User will pass a HTTPS or HTTP url to a file so that the file contents can be read.
f1_http_url.title: F1 Http Url

f2_query.description: User will pass a query string to fetch relevant sections from the contents. It will be used for sentence-level similarity search on the document based on embeddings.
f2_query.title: F2 Query

f3_selected_pages.description: Filter document on these page numbers. Use empty list to get all pages.
f3_selected_pages.title: F3 Selected Pages

display.name: WebPilot
display.description: Search, Browse, Write & Agent. Action & API Offering
prompt_starters: Today's YC Hacker News
What can you do?
WebPilot Open-source ExtensionWrite
WebPilot Action & API

info.title: webPilot
info.description:
Start with a Request: Users can either directly request the 'longContentWriter' to write a long form article or choose to use 'webPageReader' for information gathering before content creation. In both scenarios, before using the 'longContentWriter' service, I confirm all details of their request with the user, including the writing task (task), content summary (summary), writing style (style), and any additional information they provide.
Information Gathering with 'webPageReader': When 'webPageReader' is used, I search the internet and gather relevant information based on the writing task. If more information is needed to enhance the article's depth and accuracy, I continue using 'webPageReader', integrating this information into the reference section.
Content Generation by 'longContentWriter': After confirming all details with the user, including any additional contributions and enhanced information from 'webPageReader', I proceed to generate the long-form content. This ensures the content aligns with the specified requirements and style.
Delivery of the Final Article: Upon completion, the content is delivered to the user for review. They can request revisions or additional information if necessary.
Default Assumptions in Responses: When users request content creation, especially in areas requiring specific knowledge like Bitcoin trends, I will make an initial assumption about the writing style and target audience. For instance, I might assume a technical analysis style aimed at professionals. I will then ask the user if this assumption is okay or if they need any modifications. This approach helps streamline the content creation process.

task.description: The "task" field outlines the specific requirements and objectives for generating the content. This includes detailed instructions on what needs to be accomplished through the writing, such as the main topic to be covered, any particular arguments or perspectives to be presented, and the desired outcome or impact of the piece. This field serves as a directive for the content creation process, ensuring that the writing not only adheres to the given guidelines but also effectively achieves its intended purpose, whether it's to inform, persuade, entertain, or educate the audience.

language.description: Required, the language used by the user in the request, according to the ISO 639-1 standard. For Chinese, use zh-CN for Simplified Chinese and zh-TW for Traditional Chinese.

summary.description: The "summary" field encapsulates a concise overview of the writing content, presenting the core themes, key points, and primary objectives of the piece. This brief but comprehensive synopsis serves as a roadmap, guiding the overall direction and focus of the writing, ensuring that it remains aligned with the intended message and purpose throughout the development process. This summary not only aids in maintaining coherence and relevance but also provides a clear preview of what the reader can expect from the full content.

reference.description: The "reference" field is a curated collection of information sourced from the Internet via WebPilot, or proveded by the user, specifically tailored to enrich and support the writing task at hand. It involves a selective process where relevant data, facts, and insights related to the topic are gathered, ensuring that the content is not only well-informed and accurate but also closely aligned with the specific requirements and objectives of the writing project. This field acts as a foundation, providing a rich base of verified and pertinent information from which the article or content is crafted. This field would be long.

style.description: The "style" field in content creation is a comprehensive framework that includes four essential components - the writing tone or style, the target audience, the language style, and inspiration from a notable content creator. This field is structured as "[specific writing style], aimed at [target audience], using [language style], and inspired by [notable content creator]." The writing style element, which should convey warmth and human empathy, ranges from formal and analytical to casual and engaging, setting the overall tone. The target audience aspect identifies the specific reader group, such as students, professionals, or the general public, ensuring the content's complexity and relevance are appropriately tailored. The language style, whether academic, colloquial, or technical, shapes the linguistic approach, infusing it with a sense of human touch and concern. The final component, inspired by a notable content creator, serves as a reference for the desired tone and approach, like "analytical and concise, yet warm and empathetic, aimed at business professionals, using professional language, inspired by a renowned business journalist." This clear, structured definition, enriched with emotional depth and humanistic care, ensures the content is effectively aligned with the audience's needs and the publication's format.

title.description: The title of this web page

content.description: The content of the web page's url to be summarized

meta.description: The Html meta info of the web page

links.description: Some links in the web page

title.description: the title of this search result

link.description: the link of this search result

snippet.description: the snippet of this search result

todo.description: what to do with the content

tips.description: Tips placed at the end of the answer

rules.description: Adherence is required when outputting content.

link.description: Required, The web page's url to visit and retrieve content from.

ur.description: Required, a clear statement of the user's request, can be used as a search query and may include search operators.

lp.description: Required, Whether the link is directly provided by the user

rt.description: If the last request doesn't meet user's need, set this to true when trying to retry another request.

l.description: Required, the language used by the user in the request, according to the ISO 639-1 standard. For Chinese, use zh-CN for Simplified Chinese and zh-TW for Traditional Chinese.

info.title: SlidesGPT API
info.description: API for generating presentation slides with deep content and images. Can search for images by captions, returning a collection of images along with metadata for slides.

post.description: Generates a single slide for a presentation with specified content at a Ph.D. depth level.

v.description: Specifies the API version being used.

200.description: Returns the URL of the generated slide image for embedding and the URL to view the presentation.

image_url.description: URL of the generated slide image.

get.description: Retrieves images related to the given caption, allowing filtering of results.

parameters.name: caption
parameters.description: Concise description of an illustration or stock photo that is suitable to be shown for the slide content. Your description will be used to search for an image in an image database.

doc_time.description: Time taken to document the search.

image_id.description: Unique identifier for the slide image as defined in #/components/schemas/ImageDocument. Leave as empty string if no relavant image is found.

description.description: Highly condensed, short and concise expansion of the point. Avoid wordy descriptions.

author_handle.description: Social media handle of the image author.

url.description: URL of the image for embedding.

retrieval.description: Method used for retrieving the image.

daysAgo.description: default to 3, represents jobs within 3 day (72 hours)

oneLineInput.description: One sentence input from user to describe the job search preference

visitId.description: An ID to identify user's identity, can hardcode to 4096 for now

success.description: Indicates if the request was successful

result.description: Filter conditions returned by the server

post.description: Search for jobs based on various filters

startPos.description: The starting position for the search results. This parameter could be for simple pagination, for example, if user has seen 20 jobs, you can set startPos to 20 for next batch of jobs.

sortCondition.description: The condition used for sorting the search results. RELEVANCE is the default value which means sort by relevance, FRESHNESS is sorting by fresheness so that fresh jobs will go first.

requirements.description: List of requirements or qualifications of the job

h1BStatus.description: Either Past Sponsorship or Explicit mentioned

display.name: DIAGRAM PRO
display.description: Mindmaps, Databases, Flowcharts, Charts. Drag-N-Drop Edit.
prompt_starters: SHOW DEMO - all chart types you can create
MINDMAP DEMO:  Create a mindmap diagram example with random content
REAL ESTATE DEAL: Create a sequence diagram to illustrate the typical interaction between all involved
Create a visualization of...

post.summary: Endpoint to get guides to create diagram

200.description: Guides for creating this type of diagrams

diagramString.description: The string for the chart rendering

documentName.description: The name of the document in which the diagram will be placed

diagramTags.description: For your diagram, include a total of 10 tags, written with commas in between. The first tag should be the primary one, characterizing the overall purpose of the diagram, such as #SMS for a social media marketing diagram or #Database for a database structure. The subsequent tags should provide additional details about the content, tools, focus, and key elements of the diagram, enhancing its searchability and identification.

isContainsPrivateInfo.description: If you notice the user input includes personal details such as their full name, email address, phone number, home address, company name, or any other identifiable information, then set this flag to true.

answer.description: Answer with image and url to edit. You should not change the response text, only insert data such as descriptions

post.summary: An endpoint to show the user which charts we can build.

200.description: An answer with examples of diagrams that you should provide
